title: Logging in to my bank account :  works for my private bank account but no longer works for my company account !
content:
Hi, 

    I have always used my Firefox browser to access my bank accounts, one being my private account and the other for my company account.  I noticed however last week that I could not log in to my company account but I had no problem logging in to my private account.  I contacted the bank ( Handelsbank in Sweden) who were surprised but said that this problem may occasionally arise with the Firefox browser.  (However it has never happened before to me over the last 10 years!)  Is this a temporary gliche or do I have to switch to another browser ? !       The Bank start page is ;   https://www.handelsbanken.se/sv/hitta-bankkontor/uppsala-city from which I go to the company account log-in page at  ; https://secure.handelsbanken.se/logon/se/corp/sv/  On that page there are 4 log-in choices to click on .  None of these however work - i.e. I cannot access the next step !  ( I have no problem accessing my private account however by clicking on the Private log-in page at   ; https://secure.handelsbanken.se/logon/se/priv/sv/mbidqr/ )       Grateful for any support - I don´t want to switch browser from Firefox (to Microsoft Edge which seems to work for both private & company log-in.)      1000 thanks in advance,  Peter Buckley, Uppsala, Sweden

title: Firefox Multi-Account Containers | Is it possible to "limit to designated" no matter what is the subdomain?
content:
When I'm using Firefox Multi-Account Containers with the option "Limit to designated sites" enabled, I encounter an annoying issue when navigating between different subdomains of the same website.

For example, if you navigate from "https://www.google.com" to "https://accounts.google.com," you will exit the "Google" container until that subdomain is manually added to the container.

I thought it would be nice if I could somehow create a container for "https://*.google.com/" (where * acts as a wildcard, as explained in the note below).

  • Is it possible to do this? If so, how, and what is the safest way? (See note below)
  • If not, is there any viable solution to this problem?

Note: The RegEx (or wildcard) * should only allow alphanumeric variations to prevent security vulnerabilities. For instance, "https://www.PhishingSite.com/WeStealYourAccount.google.com" could bypass the container if * is not restricted properly. In this case, * could mistakenly refer to "www.PhishingSite.com/WeStealYourAccount"

Thank you for your help

title: Geen verbinding gemaakt: mogelijk beveiligingsprobleem
content:
Geen verbinding gemaakt: mogelijk beveiligingsprobleem

Firefox heeft een mogelijk beveiligingsrisico gedetecteerd en is niet doorgegaan naar raxon.org, omdat deze website een beveiligde verbinding vereist.

Nu wilde ik een staging server opzetten op poort 5006 van de server. nu is deze niet vanaf buiten benaderbaar maar op een intern netwerk (10.0.0.10:5006) kan ik verbinden. dus ik heb de domeinnaam van mij in de windows host file gezet en deze verwezen naar 10.0.0.10 zodat ik intern kan verbinden naar poort 5006.

Echter krijg ik dan een beveiligings melding omdat het een self signed certificaat betreft. Ik kan helaas niet meer doorklikken maar wel het certificaat bekijken.

het zou mooi zijn,dat daar een knop onderaan / bovenaan komt met accepteren zodat de pagina geopend wordt. Nu wordt ie geblokkeerd en kan hem niet als staging server gebruiken.

title: How safe is this?
content:
The makers of the Avada theme for WordPress adviced to set dom.events.testing.asyncClipboard to true for the copy paste function between sites. A function they have added recently.

However, here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1411533 I saw this comment:

"Recommendations to flip dom.events.testing.asyncClipboard to true are a fundamentally bad idea. This pref was meant for automated testing, and bypasses all security/permission checks on clipboard access.

If you toggle this pref, any site has full access to your clipboard all the time without asking you or you even noticing so we suggest that you do not touch that pref.

Had the same problem with firefox and outlook web.

My solution was: 

  open "about:config" in firefox (type it in the webadress line and hit enter)   accept the risk in the pop up   type "clipboard" in the search line   change the following settings (as shown in the image attachment) from false to true (klick on false)   restart firefox (close it & open it again)"

The image attachment mentioned, showed that dom.events.testing.asyncClipboard WAS set to true. So now I am confused :-D.

Is it dangerous to set it true and why?

title: Accessing Mozilla Account Passwords Without Importing Data
content:
Hello. I have a question out of curiosity regarding Mozilla accounts. Suppose I'm at my aunt's house and need to use her PC to retrieve just one password from my Firefox account. Is there a way to access that password without importing all of my account data into her browser?

I’ve tried logging into my account in a private window, but it still imported everything. In the case of Chrome, Google has a Password Manager that lets you access individual passwords without syncing or importing all data to the browser. Does Mozilla have a similar feature? If accessing a single password is possible, why does it seem so difficult? And if it isn't, why is that the case?

Kind regards, Wiktor
